item.title: Current Courses | Juliana Lima
item.description:
Syllabi and reading schedules coming soon!
PHI 1000 - Introduction to Philosophy This is an Introduction to Philosophy course. We will read and discuss theories about traditional topics in philosophy about the nature of mind, the nature of knowledge, personal identity, and free will. But we will also discuss more recent topics, such as: social ontology: how, why, and if concepts of race, gender, and disability are social constructs; social epistemology: how knowledge and desires we have come from others, and how to avoid falling into epistemic “traps”, such as echo chambers and epistemic bubbles.

item.title: Past Courses | Juliana Lima
item.description: Here’s the syllabus of courses I have taught: Critical Thinking Seminar: Philosophy of Mind Introduction to Philosophy of Language Critical Thinking I actively seek feedback from my students with mid-semester evaluations. Here you’ll find three different mid-semester evaluations I typically give to students: a general course evaluation, a course evaluation students take right after they submit their midterm assignment without knowing their grades, and another after they get back their graded midterm.
